page.title: 18HOUSING
page.content: The oldest houses in Lenham date back to the 15th. Century. They surround The Square and the shops. This is a Conservation Area. Three housing estates are situated conveniently near the schools. The private estate, south of Ham Lane, where some commuters to London live, adjoins the railway. Just across the A.20 on the Faversham Road is a small council estate and a group of cottages. On the Pilgrim's Way there are a few large bungalows and houses. There are small numbers of private houses along the four roads which meet in The Square. Outside the village there are several large manors including Chilston Manor, Royton Manor and Lenham Court. There is an estate agent in the village square.
